decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly swarm the battlefield with Elf creatures and ramp up mana production to play powerful spells and creatures. Using cards like Llanowar Elves, Priest of Titania, and Fyndhorn Elves, the deck aims to build a strong presence early in the game. Supporting cards like Timberwatch Elf and Nyxborn Hydra provide additional power and ways to buff the army of Elves. Lead the Stampede helps refill the hand with more creatures, while Quirion Ranger allows for additional mana efficiency. Wellwisher provides a bit of lifegain to help sustain against aggressive opponents. Masked Vandal and Generous Ent offer removal options and disruption. Overall, this deck is designed to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive Elf tribal strategy.

This Mono Blue Aggro deck focuses on playing cheap and efficient spells to control the board and quickly reduce the opponent's life total. The deck includes a mix of counterspells, card draw, and aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent. By utilizing spells like Brainstorm and Thought Scour to dig for threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan, the deck aims to apply constant pressure while maintaining card advantage. Additionally, cards like Tolarian Terror and Deem Inferior provide additional ways to deal direct damage and finish off the opponent.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using powerful removal spells like Snuff Out and Counterspell to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also utilizes card draw and graveyard manipulation with cards like Thought Scour and Mental Note to maintain card advantage and fuel delve spells like Gurmag Angler. Additionally, the deck includes disruptive spells like Spell Pierce and Unexpected Fangs to protect its own threats and deny the opponent's key plays. By efficiently managing resources and disrupting the opponent, this deck aims to outlast and outvalue its opponent to secure victory.

The core idea of this Mono Blue Aggro deck is to aggressively control the board while utilizing card advantage and tempo plays to overwhelm the opponent. By combining efficient counterspells and card draw with aggressive threats like Delver of Secrets and Cryptic Serpent, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain momentum throughout the game. Additionally, disruptive spells like Boomerang and Sleep of the Dead help disrupt the opponent's game plan while allowing the deck to further establish its own tempo advantage.

This deck is built around the idea of playing multiple elves to quickly build a wide board presence and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creatures and pump effects. By utilizing mana acceleration from creatures like Llanowar Elves and Priest of Titania, the deck aims to quickly develop its board and follow up with cards like Timberwatch Elf to boost the power of its creatures. Lead the Stampede and Winding Way help refill the hand with more creatures, while Vines of Vastwood provide protection for key creatures. With an aggressive and efficient playstyle, this deck aims to close out games quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to generate a high amount of mana by chaining together spells that untap Islands, specifically utilizing the card High Tide to double the output of each Island. This mana is then used to cast powerful spells and combo off by drawing through the deck quickly with cantrips and card draw spells, ultimately leading to a game-winning play or overwhelming the opponent with card advantage and resources.

The main idea of this Mono Black Aggro deck is to swarm the board with cheap creatures like Carrion Feeder and Mortician Beetle, and then sacrifice them for value with effects like Bloodthrone Vampire and Rite of Consumption. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly by sacrificing creatures for additional value and card draw with Village Rites. With a focus on aggressive creatures and sacrifice effects, this deck can put immense pressure on opponents and close out games swiftly.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creatures like Glistener Elf, Blighted Agent, and Ichorclaw Myr, supported by pump spells like Might of Old Krosa and Mutagenic Growth. The goal is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with infect damage, while protecting your creatures with cards like Snakeskin Veil. Distortion Strike and Relic's Roar provide evasion and removal options, while Embiggen and Rancor help boost the power of your creatures. With a mix of infect creatures and pump spells, this deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can mount a defense.

This deck focuses on filling the board with low-cost, evasive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing efficient counterspells and card draw, it aims to maintain board control and tempo advantage. The inclusion of ninjas and faeries adds additional synergy and utility to the deck, allowing for efficient removal and card advantage. The goal is to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain a strong presence on the battlefield to secure a quick victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to generate quick and efficient damage, with cards like Galvanic Blast and Myr Enforcer contributing to a fast-paced aggressive strategy. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtcast and Refurbished Familiar to draw additional resources and maintain momentum. With a mix of artifact creatures and spells, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly while still retaining the ability to control the battlefield with cards like Nihil Spellbomb and Krark-Clan Shaman. The deck's mana base includes various artifact lands to support its affinity theme.
